objectives: Apply learned vocabulary in conversations about playing video games
Compare different perspectives on playing video games

multiple_intelligences.linguistic: Write a story or essay about playing video games
multiple_intelligences.logical_mathematical: Analyze patterns and create logical arguments about playing video games
multiple_intelligences.spatial: Create visual representations or mind maps of playing video games
multiple_intelligences.bodily_kinesthetic: Role-play or act out scenarios related to playing video games
multiple_intelligences.musical: Create a song or rhythm exercise about playing video games
multiple_intelligences.interpersonal: Collaborate in groups to discuss playing video games
multiple_intelligences.intrapersonal: Reflect individually on personal connection to playing video games
multiple_intelligences.naturalistic: Categorize and classify concepts related to playing video games

content.basic: Simplified texts and basic vocabulary about playing video games
content.intermediate: Standard complexity materials with support about playing video games
content.advanced: Complex authentic materials and academic texts about playing video games

process.grouping: Individual, pairs, small groups, or whole class based on preference
process.choice: Multiple activity options aligned with learning style

differentiation.environment: Open space allowing movement and hands-on activities

warm_up.description: Students move around and interact physically related to playing video games
warm_up.materials: Space for movement, props if needed

main_activities.description: Students receive information about playing video games through kinesthetic modality
Students practice language related to playing video games using kinesthetic approach
Students produce original content about playing video games demonstrating intermediate thinking

discussion_prompts: How does playing video games affect people?
What are the advantages and disadvantages of playing video games?
How would you solve problems related to playing video games?

vocabulary_support.tier_2: Academic and topic-specific words for playing video games
vocabulary_support.tier_3: Domain-specific technical terms related to playing video games

homework_options.required: Core assignment at intermediate level using kinesthetic approach

teacher_notes.grouping_suggestions: Flexible grouping based on readiness and interest
teacher_notes.time_management: Build in flexibility for different pacing needs

common_difficulties: Students may lack background knowledge about playing video games
Vocabulary may be challenging for some students
Some students may need more processing time
methodology: UDL + Differentiated Instruction + CLT + Multiple Intelligences
references: CAST Universal Design for Learning Guidelines
